dlgLine.text: Still alive, I see. I suppose you're here for fuel?

dlgAnsw.text: I am.
I had some other business.

dlgLine.text: You must be from the Splendid group I've heard so much about. Taking a risk to come out into one of the Son's strongholds,,,
I'm impressed! So... how can we help each other?

dlgAnsw.text: We need you to set up a meeting with the head of the milita.
You're a member of the Texas Sons militia. I just want info on them.
We want to trade for fuel.
Give us fuel and you don't get hurt.

dlgLine.text: Castillo...
Nash...
I should've known you'd come crawling around here at some point.
Believe me, the last thing I wanted to see today is that smug face of yours.
You hardheaded son of a bitch...
<Laughs> Good to see you alive and well. So, what can I do for your group, Vic? That is what you're here for, right?

dlgAnsw.text: We need to meet with the leader of the Texas Sons.
We need fuel.
We need info.

dlgLine.text: Assuming I even wanted to do so, Jefferson Claude only sees people that can be personally vouched for. Is there anything else I can do for you?

dlgAnsw.text: You could vouch for me.
I think he'd want to hear what I have to offer.
I'd like to trade for fuel.
I'd like to exchange info with you.
I think we're done here for now.

dlgLine.text: That's more of the Claudes' department - Jefferson's anyway. However, I'm guessing you're not here for a pamphlet.
Here's my advice for you - leave the Sons alone. That's all they want from anyone. As long as you leave them alone, neither of you will have a problem.
However, I think you will find that I'm a bit more open to negotiation. Don't interpret that as weakness - I'm still a member of the Sons, I'd just rather not waste ammo.

dlgAnsw.text: I'd like to discuss some other info.
I'd like to talk business.
I think we're done here. I should get going.

dlgLine.text: Since I've known you for a matter of minutes, why would I do that?

dlgAnsw.text: Okay - name your price.
I have an interesting proposition for him.
If you don't, I could feed your arm to some corpses while you watch. Your choice.
Never mind. Let's discuss something else.

dlgLine.text: Let's work something out.

dlgAnsw.text: I'm interested in acquiring some fuel.
I'm interested in any info you can offer.
I need to set up a meeting with the head of the Texas Sons of Liberty.
Have you thought of leaving? I could use someone like you on my team.
I think our business is concluded here.

dlgLine.text: Hmm... You know that's the funny thing. If I set up this meeting and something goes wrong, it doesn't reflect well on me. And, well, when the Claude brothers are unhappy...
I tell you what I will do. The Sons have been getting hit by a squad of soldiers that still think they run things around here. If you can get me five dogtags, I can get you a meeting with Jefferson.

dlgAnsw.text: You want me to kill soldiers?
Why are they attacking the Sons?
Do I have to kill them?
Consider it done.
I'm sorry, I can't do that. I don't need anymore enemies.

dlgLine.text: They call themselves 'soldiers' but they serve their own interests. We're an organization with roots in this state - they're thugs. I'm sure it's just a matter of time before they hit your people as well.

dlgAnsw.text: Do I have to kill them?
Consider it done.
I'm sorry, I can't do that. I don't need anymore enemies.

dlgLine.text: If you're lucky, the stiffs have already done that for you. All I need is proof that they're dead.

dlgAnsw.text: Consider it done.
I'm sorry, I can't do that. I don't need anymore enemies.

dlgLine.text: Let's hope you can. I should warn you, there's a reason I'm not in a hurry to send my men after them. However, if you pull it off, help yourself to whatever guns they tried to kill you with.

dlgAnsw.text: Let's talk about some other business.
I'll be back when it's done.

dlgLine.text: I doubt it... Why don't you tell me, then I'll convince him, if I think I can get a finder's fee out of this.

dlgAnsw.text: I propose an alliance.
I'll only tell him.
I have food to trade.
I have a cure for the infection.
Whatever you need, I have it.

dlgLine.text: I'm going to chalk that up to a lack of protein. Tends to dull the brain a bit. I assume that's it, because clearly you're outnumbered and outgunned.
Please ask yourself - do I want my life to end today? Since you've made it this far, I'm going to assume you don't.

dlgAnsw.text: No.
Sorry - it's the protein thing, like you said.
You assume I'm going to lose - I'm not. <Attack>
While we've been talking, I've been figuring out how to kill you and your men. I'm done now. <Attack>

dlgLine.text: That's unfortunate, because that's about the only thing that will get Jefferson's attention. Which is why I suggested it. If that's all you came out here for, I'm sorry - that's about all I can offer.

dlgAnsw.text: Okay, I'll take them out.
Let's discuss something else.
Then I'm done here.

dlgLine.text: Good, good. I'll have one of my men show you out. Best of luck.

dlgAnsw.text: <You are taken back to the gate.>

dlgLine.text: So, the meeting with Jefferson - that's not going to happen. And to be fair, had you said something like that around him, you'd be killed on the spot.
But, I'm still hoping there's some benefit to me to be had, so...

dlgAnsw.text: - New Answ -

dlgLine.text: One of my men will show you out. Let's do this again sometime, if you're still around.

dlgAnsw.text: <You are taken back to the gate.>

dlgLine.text: Interesting... But, our last estimate of your school's forces was not favorable. And we are currently seeing raids from the remnants of the military. So... you're saying you'll help us fight them?

dlgAnsw.text: Yes, that's what I'm saying.
No - my people won't accept that.

dlgLine.text: I can't help you then. But I don't want you to waste a trip - maybe there's something else I can do?

dlgAnsw.text: - New Answ -

dlgLine.text: We have food and fuel, obviously. At this point, the only thing we would trade anything for is pilots or doctors. I doubt anyone would be stupid enough to let those kind of personnel go.

dlgAnsw.text: I'm willing to negotiate for the greater good.
You would be correct.

dlgLine.text: ...Really? And I should just accept your word for that? Because I've heard of several so-called cures now - amputation, anti-viral medicine, blood transfusions. All I have to show for it is a lot of fresh graves.
Even if you had one, I doubt the Claudes would have the personnel to manage it. So... what else you got?
That's what desperate people say. I can't broker a deal based on good feelings. Now, fuel - show me something and that I might be able to do.

dlgAnsw.text: - New Answ -

dlgLine.text: You've got my ear. Okay, I'll send a message to the militia in Fredericksburg.

A word of advice - you had better deliver. I can talk my way out of a miscalculation of character, but Jefferson is not a patient or foolish man. If you value the life of your people, finish your business without incident and get out of there.

dlgAnsw.text: Will do. Now, let's talk about some other business.
Good to know. I'll be going now.

dlgLine.text: Information used to be so cheap. Fortunately for me, it's as precious as the fuel here.

dlgAnsw.text: - New Answ -

dlgLine.text: Let's see if we can help each other out.

dlgAnsw.text: I need info about the militia.
Have you heard anything about what's going on in the rest of the country?
What do you know about the military in this area?
If there are areas the militia aren't interested in looting, I'll buy the locations from you.
I've got other business to discuss with you.

dlgLine.text: I'll give this one to you for free - the milita has been preparing for the end of the world for a lot longer than you have. What you've done in Splendid is impressive, but it's nothing compared to the militia's organization.
All we want is to be left alone - it's not that Jefferson doesn't know about you, it's that he doesn't care.

dlgAnsw.text: Let me ask you something else.
Let's get back to business.
I think that concludes our business - I should go.

dlgLine.text: Gossip, mostly. We're not very concerned about the rest of the country.
From what I have heard, stiffs have taken most of it over. My advice - wait for them to decay and take whatever city you like. The world is our big, rotting oyster.

dlgAnsw.text: Let me ask you something else.
Let's get back to business.
I think that concludes our business - I should go.

dlgLine.text: We interrogated a soldier with methods the military would approve of. If their commander knows anything, they aren't telling the rank and file. We believe there's a command structure left somewhere in the country, but it's not in Washington D.C. anymore.
As far as I can tell, any remnants of the military left are likely acting on old orders. Jefferson probably knows where their base is by now, but if he does, he hasn't decided what to do yet.
I'm only telling this because you'd actually be helping us if you managed to take them out.

dlgAnsw.text: Let me ask you something else.
Let's get back to business.
I think that concludes our business - I should go.

dlgLine.text: I have one place that frankly is not worth the trip for us. I'll trade it to you for ten rounds of 9mm ammo.

dlgAnsw.text: Okay. <-10 9mm ammo>
Since it's no use to you, I'll give you five. <-5 9mm ammo>
Not interested. Let's talk about something else.

dlgLine.text: Alright, that'll do. Here's what I have.

There's an intact Bullseye department store near Eastland. I'll mark it on your map. It's a bit far for us, and from what I understand, it's inhabited. Hopefully you'll find something worth more than you just paid me.

dlgAnsw.text: I have a question about something else.
Let's get back to business.
I think that concludes our business - I should go.

dlgLine.text: Fuel, hmm. The fuel here belongs to the militia and I am merely its caretaker.
Of course, a small amount of it evaporates here and there, accounting for a loss. I doubt anyone would notice the discrepancy if I could distract them with something better.

dlgAnsw.text: What do you want for it?
How about you give us the fuel or we take it from you?
You misunderstand - I didn't come here to trade. <Attack>

dlgLine.text: Let's see if you have anything we need.

dlgAnsw.text: I'll trade you 10 rounds of 9mm for 1 gallon of fuel.
I'll trade you 1 dogtag for half a gallon of fuel.
These dogtags are worth a lot more - 1 dogtag for 1 gallon of fuel.
I like free. <Attack>
Let's talk about some other business.

dlgLine.text: We can always use 9mm ammo to clear the stiffs around the wall - I can give you a small amount for ammo. Now, if you were to bring me some soldier dogtags, I could be a lot more generous.

dlgAnsw.text: - New Answ -

dlgLine.text: Here's what I'm going to do for you - I'm going to allow you to walk away and you never show your face here again.

dlgAnsw.text: Okay, we're going peacefully.
I'm not leaving without the fuel. <Attack>
Just testing the waters - I'll pay whatever the going rate is, of course.
Your biggest mistake was letting me in. <Attack>

dlgLine.text: Escort them out.

dlgAnsw.text: <You are escorted out.>

dlgLine.text: Not the smartest move, but maybe one I would have made myself. Okay...

dlgAnsw.text: - New Answ -

dlgLine.text: Easily done... Anything else?

dlgAnsw.text: I'd like to make another trade.
I have some other business.
I'll be leaving now.

dlgLine.text: Done. Well worth it.

dlgAnsw.text: I'd like to make another trade.
I have some other business.
I'll be leaving now.

dlgLine.text: A shrewd move. I can respect that - consider it done.

dlgAnsw.text: I'd like to make another trade.
I have some other business.
I'll be leaving now.

dlgLine.text: Hmm... I did get them to offer you a position. You could have been sitting pretty here with me.
You know why I couldn't do that.
You never could stop being a cop, could you? Okay, Vic... for you, I'll set up a meeting. They're in Fredericksburg - here, let me show you.

And... do I have to say it? Don't do anything stupid or Jefferson will kill you, and there won't be a thing I can do about it. Take care of your business and get back to Splendid as quickly as possible.
I appreciate this, Nash.

dlgAnsw.text: - New Answ -

dlgLine.text: Something else I can do for you, Vic?

dlgAnsw.text: We need to set up a meeting with the leader of the Sons.
We need fuel.
We need information.
We want the fuel - all of it. Either you help us or you can die here.
You're friends with Vic - why don't you come with us?
That's all for now. Let's go, Vic.

dlgLine.text: Yeah... I can't help but notice you're sitting on more crude than you could possibly use in this lifetime.
Me? No. This is the militia's strategic reserve and I'm just guarding it.
Come on, Nash... Don't bullshit me.
Well, one of our holding tanks might have recently developed an unfortunate leak... I can give you twenty gallons. This is a one time favor, Vic. Don't make this a habit.
I owe you one, Nash.

dlgAnsw.text: - New Answ -

dlgLine.text: I might have some.

dlgAnsw.text: What can you tell us about the militia's numbers?
Have you heard anything about what's going on in the rest of the country?
Do you know anything about the military in this area?
We're looking for places to hit for supplies. Know of any?
We have something else to discuss.

dlgLine.text: You know I can't do that.
Still being run by the Claude brothers?

That's no secret. Look, Vic - for the sake of your group, you're better off leaving them alone. We know all about your school in Splendid, and we don't care. Leave our territory alone and you won't have a problem.

dlgAnsw.text: I need some more info.
We have other business to discuss.

dlgLine.text: We're more concerned about our territory. All I know is, if you were ever in the market for land, you're going to have your pick of properties after those stiffs rot away.

dlgAnsw.text: I need some more info.
We have other business to discuss.

dlgLine.text: All too well. Since the Sons are sitting on the biggest food and fuel supplies in the state, we've been hit several times by soldiers.
And you didn't do anything to provoke them?
We protected what was rightly ours. Now, you know I didn't care much for the government before, but these soldiers that are left - they're nothing more but thugs. You'd be wise to watch out for them.

dlgAnsw.text: I need some more info.
We have other business to discuss.

dlgLine.text: I do have something that might be worth it to you...
And if it was of any use to you, you would have already hit it.
You know me too well. Okay, Vic - over in Eastland, there's an intact Bullseye store. Don't know who's in it, but it's not worth the trip for us to find out. It's all yours, if you're feeling lucky.
Eastland, huh? Well, maybe if we get desperate.

dlgAnsw.text: I need some more info.
We have other business to discuss.

dlgLine.text: I'll show you out.
Thanks again, Nash... It was good to see you again.
Best of luck out there. I mean it.

dlgAnsw.text: <Nash shows you to the gate.>

dlgLine.text: Friend or not, you get your people under control, Vic.
What the hell are you doing? Goddamit, we're not here for this - back off, now!

dlgAnsw.text: Okay... I'm sorry.
This is bigger than friendship, Vic - we need that fuel if we're going to survive.
I'm in charge - not you! Take them down! <Attack>

dlgLine.text: Survive? When the militia finds out about this, they will burn your school to the ground.

dlgAnsw.text: <You hear the sound of a shotgun being cocked outside Nash's door.>

dlgLine.text: Vic - my offer still stands. As for the rest of your group, any of them show their faces here again and I will open fire.
Nash - you gotta believe me, I didn't know about any of this.

dlgAnsw.text: - New Answ -

dlgLine.text: I wasn't going to bring it up, but we really could use your help.

I'm afraid that's just not possible. I'm not just saying that because of the militia's resources or my responsibilities. If I defected, if I brought over any men or fuel, Jefferson would tear your place apart to get to me.
Men like Jefferson, you don't cross them. I'm sorry, Vic. I'm sticking my neck out just helping you.

dlgAnsw.text: We have other business to discuss.
That's all for now. Let's go, Vic.

dlgLine.text: I'm sure you could. But for now, I'm in a pretty good position, as you can see. I'll keep you in mind if that changes.
But that doesn't mean we can't do business, right?

dlgAnsw.text: - New Answ -

dlgLine.text: Let's work something out.

dlgAnsw.text: I'm interested in acquiring some fuel.
I'm interested in any info you can offer.
I need to set up a meeting with the head of the Texas Sons of Liberty.
Have you thought of leaving? I could use someone like you on my team.
I think our business is concluded here.
